SENT.plain: Hybrids constructed with the murine fibroblasts IT22 and either human lymphoid cells or human melanoma cells retain the human chromosomes 1, 14, and 21 and lose the human chromosome 2

The human lymphocyte-mouse fibroblast hybrids preferentially retain the human chromosome 11, while the human melanoma-murine fibroblast hybrids preferentially retain the human chromosome 8 and lose the human chromosome X
These data suggest that the type of human parental cell used to construct human-rodent hybrids can influence the segregation of human chromosomes
